title: Grade 11 - Understanding Fashion HNC3C College Preparation (2013)
subject: Social Science and Humanities

document.title: Grade 11 - Understanding Fashion HNC3C College Preparation (2013)

59ACF919A96B4226B8C3E26F41C7F031.description: demonstrate the ability to apply basic skills and construction techniques when creating fashion products (e.g., finishing seams, sewing in zippers, hemming, using fasteners)

D34EB07353FF47FCB8A9CD1D1EDB9825.description: identify and describe basic skills and construction techniques used in the creation of fashion products (e.g., finishing seams, sewing darts, gathering and easing fabric, making buttonholes, sewing in zippers, hemming, reducing bulk, using stabilizers and interfacing)

173E097A43234F42BF25DAEA0B8704E4.description: demonstrate the ability to follow preconstruction procedures (e.g., measuring; interpreting patterns, including their abbreviations, and laying out patterns; selecting and preparing fabrics; fitting and altering patterns; understanding knitting, crocheting, or jewellery-making instructions) when creating fashion products

D377E6C1C0CD49199518DBC896AD49E8.description: Procedures, Skills, and Techniques: demonstrate the ability to use appropriate procedures, skills, and techniques when creating fashion products

707F4C1B194D45F9A2DCE5BB28E19195.description: use tools and technologies correctly when creating fashion products (e.g., tools and technologies associated with cutting, pressing, pinning, sewing, knitting, crocheting, felting, embroidering, dyeing)

B7FB241DBB4543079987207388439D93.description: demonstrate the safe use of tools and technologies when creating fashion products (e.g., keep pins in a pin cushion, store the iron on its heel when not in use, promptly replace blunt or bent needles in sewing machines or sergers)

586073B4ABBE4C3E9F52761033AC7E61.description: identify various tools and technologies used in the creation of fashion products, and describe their function (e.g., measuring tape, seam ripper, scissors, pinking shears, iron, pressing ham, sewing machine, serger, loom, knitting needles, crochet hook)

28C6A8D45B9B472D8818229BEE1203CA.description: Tools and Technologies: describe a variety of tools and technologies associated with the creation of fashion products, and use tools and technologies safely and correctly when creating such products;

09E2139B00B9492A8EEB79A919150B3C.description: apply the elements and principles of design when creating fashion-related products (e.g., when creating fashion illustrations, fashion sketches, apparel for paper dolls of different body shapes; when designing a garment; when engaged in a sewing project)

DF3BE43F6FA345AFA15E48ED7AB571C6.description: analyse the impact that apparel and/or accessories reflecting various elements and principles of design can have on a person's appearance and the impression he or she creates

D60912D43C724439AD3C924B57CE0D5D.description: identify and describe the elements and principles of design as they apply to fashion products (e.g., line, colour, shape, texture, balance, proportion, rhythm, emphasis, harmony)

C4D442D00BEB43CC98FBB386ACF59B7C.description: Elements and Principles of Design: demonstrate an understanding of the elements and principles of design, and of how they can be used to different effect in the creation of fashion products;

8A7EEC37DCC34C9AB578DB96978D9D1F.description: apply their knowledge of the basic characteristics of various fibres and fabrics and their environmental impact when choosing appropriate fabrics for various fashion products

FD81BF3E5E534762A38441DCDBEA660C.description: describe strategies to reduce the environmental impact of the production of various fibres, fabrics, and finishes (e.g., purchasing garments made from organic cotton or hemp, using plantbased dyes, buying second-hand clothes, limiting the use of stain-resistant fabric)

7B72F13350594BF69DF121E8207C8278.description: describe the environmental impact of the production, use, and care of various fibres and fabrics (e.g., the impact of farming cotton, hemp, bamboo, sheep, silkworms; of the production process for various synthetic fabrics and dyes; of dry cleaning)

E7105D178BD44A0EB9548681FDB8A047.description: describe characteristics of various types of dyes (e.g., natural, acid, reactive, solvent) and fabric finishes (e.g., waterproof, flame-retardant, wrinkle-resistant, stain-resistant finishes), and describe the effects they have on fabrics

C224AA343D7A407DA6A35678BB2E5A7A.description: describe characteristics of different types of woven fabrics (e.g., canvas, chino, damask, linen, percale), knit fabrics (e.g., jersey, tricot, velour, boiled wool), and non-woven fabrics (e.g., leather, fur, felt) used in various fashion products

BBACA5FF698E4C52937FB2507D552471.description: identify the advantages and disadvantages of common natural and synthetic fibres (e.g., cotton is lightweight, breathable, and easy to find, but it can shrink when washed and is easily creased; silk is hypoallergenic, breathable, and strong, but it is expensive and the fibres are weakened by perspiration; spandex increases the stretch of a garment, but it is not breathable; polyester is relatively inexpensive and holds its shape and colour, but it is not absorbent, does not breathe, and can cling as a result of static electricity)

BC93B5F33CC444619982653233EE5A82.description: Fibres, Fabrics, and the Environment: demonstrate an understanding of fibres, fabrics, and finishes, and of the environmental impact associated with their production and use.

2D57C6246E9B4361886B3732C84FAD2F.description: analyse fashion promotions and products that raise awareness of social issues (e.g., charity fashion shows such as Fashion Cares, ribbons symbolizing issues such as breast cancer and HIV/AIDS awareness, T-shirts with messages, reusable shopping bags)

05C824CC072C4465BFE565A18FCB4963.description: describe strategies that consumers can use to make informed and responsible fashion purchases (e.g., checking textile labels, comparison shopping, checking warranties/guarantees, wardrobe assessment, checking return policies, investigating the working conditions under which the garment was produced and sold)

3CF8060747BC4F38B9AE724F16B6857B.description: explain how marketing in the fashion industry can affect consumer behaviour (e.g., impulse buying, accessorizing, combination buying, buying items endorsed by celebrities)

986F5CC0673E44739E600869DB41DFB9.description: explain strategies that fashion marketers use to create a sense of need among consumers, and describe the effects of these strategies (e.g., manufacturing demand for clothing that has "cool" labels/logos; convincing consumers to replace garments that are out of style rather than worn out; creating a market for positional goods, whose value is based on exclusivity, and knock-offs of these items)

1D41D6C2741645B2923D71E72FDD4447.description: explain the elements of marketing in the fashion industry (i.e., product, placement, price, promotion)

E61426B070A941A7809296255E3E94C3.description: Consumer Behaviour and Fashion Marketing: demonstrate an understanding of consumer behaviour and marketing strategies, including specific social marketing promotions, associated with the fashion industry;

A2859E28CABF4DF5A322477782CDEA9F.description: Marketing, Environmental Responsibility, and Consumer Behaviour

58453990B8F1472A8DD71309CCFC2E6D.description: analyse how social factors, including current events, influence fashion trends and cycles (e.g., factors such as historical events, technological advances, economic factors, geographical factors, environmental issues)

9FE5384B4DF040379DE60C421F5BC038.description: explain theories that have been developed to account for the origin and adoption of fashion trends (e.g., trickle up, trickle down, trickle across), and describe the use of these theories in the fashion business

3370F5042A024C84AF2E6E7E97BEF40F.description: identify and describe the stages of a fashion cycle (i.e., introduction, growth, maturity, decline, and obsolescence)

9086F1381C154D63A5A8354BD5E2A10F.description: Fashion Cycles and Trends: demonstrate an understanding of fashion cycles and trends and of factors that influence them

BEEA6357D7484E4BA5B4957DF2B31AF8.description: analyse how the media influence social norms with respect to fashion, and describe the effect these norms can have (e.g., how young pop stars wearing revealing clothing in music videos contributes to the hypersexualization of children)

73E970252DB84E08BAABB778231E1460.description: explain the ways in which different media (e.g., music videos, television shows, movies, the Internet, fashion magazines, billboards, window displays) influence the fashion industry and individual fashion choices

F3E3A6EF0EBE4A44901BB62A7C18078E.description: Media Influences: demonstrate an understanding of how media influence fashion;

224408832D2745E3AEA5BD9EF3008DE2.description: describe ways in which current fashion trends reflect aspects of garments and adornment associated with various cultures (e.g., the Mandarin collar, moccasins, nose piercings, the keffiyeh, dashikis)

169048A54F02420296F69B68348E7E3D.description: explain how various garments and styles of personal adornment express a person's cultural identity and heritage (e.g., kilts identify Scottish clans; items such as a hijab, burka, or kippah identify the religion of the wearer)

57B36EDB902242FCBB10799BF1E776E4.description: identify and describe garments and styles of personal adornment typical of various cultures (e.g., sari, turban, parka, kimono, ribbon shirt, dance shawl, kilt, hijab, burka, yarmulke, tattoos, scarification, piercings)

439A68CE66224929B5EB029AC2164561.description: Cultural Influences: demonstrate an understanding of how culture influences fashion;

859BD1FAEA03464C82E82411A5FFDBB2.description: demonstrate an understanding of the general research process by reflecting on and evaluating their own research, inquiry, and communication skills

3F5960ED95594BAB8DDD601F4A187075.description: clearly communicate the results of their inquiries (e.g., write clearly, organize ideas logically, use language conventions properly), and follow APA conventions for acknowledging sources (e.g., generate a reference list in APA style, use in-text author-date citations)

7886CACF17F24D70AC30C1228FB3F791.description: use terms relating to fashion correctly (e.g., fashion cycles, marketing, positional goods, pattern, dart, seam, gather, ease, line, colour, shape, texture)

39F5066FCB504C2382264193EFB35B04.description: use an appropriate format (e.g., oral presentation, written research report, poster, multimedia presentation, web page) to communicate the results of their research and inquiry effectively for a specific purpose and audience

52AA8FBFFA5842F98ECE9D76DFA90501.description: Communicating and Reflecting: communicate the results of their research and inquiry clearly and effectively, and reflect on and evaluate their research, inquiry, and communication skills.

555A2D3CA5BB432985489E4C88AC4BE6.description: synthesize findings and formulate conclusions (e.g., determine whether their results support or contradict their hypothesis; weigh and connect information to determine the answer to their research question)

7063C8AB50914C2C84F74C85D30912A6.description: demonstrate academic honesty by documenting the sources of all information generated through research

AED11F93667446AFAA7C95E4C44777AB.description: analyse and interpret research information (e.g., compare observations with predictions; determine whether common themes arise in research from/on different periods)

E151A21CEDF5485BB2477B453101DD7D.description: record and organize information and key ideas using a variety of formats (e.g., notes, graphic organizers, summaries, audio/digital records)

2A8D4419D15E4152A908674E990A757F.description: assess various aspects of information gathered from primary and secondary sources (e.g., accuracy, relevance, reliability, inherent values and bias, voice)

5AF9B04BEB3943CE8B4950D365A292D5.description: Processing Information: assess, record, analyse, and synthesize information gathered through research and inquiry

5E2F7E5FCBEC4529B65C273C4B1CF49A.description: based on preliminary research, for each investigation formulate a hypothesis, thesis statement, or research question, and use it to focus their research

9657F15B61B5491F838F959E0C084ADA.description: locate and select information relevant to their investigations from a variety of primary sources (e.g., interviews, observations, surveys, questionnaires, photographs in magazines, billboards) and/or secondary sources (e.g., textbooks, book reviews)

373D6A58E0D64C718B11436051550F29.description: create appropriate research plans to investigate their selected topics (e.g., outline purpose and method, identify sources of information), ensuring that their plans follow guidelines for ethical research

E29B4354F8B142D89169E61FA547E3E8.description: Investigating: create research plans, and locate and select information relevant to their chosen topics, using appropriate social science research and inquiry methods;

88745288FE6C41808AA472F3E8CEAC3C.description: formulate effective questions to guide their research and inquiry

810DB9F6A534434B906353575B10D04C.description: identify key concepts (e.g., through discussion, brainstorming, use of visual organizers) related to their chosen topic

1958504906754C2D89FCC64D3352B06B.description: explore a variety of topics related to fashion (e.g., cultural influences on dress, fashion cycles, fashion marketing, media and advertising, body image, fibre and fabric characteristics, elements and principles of design) to identify topics for research and inquiry

3A30CABAB5A044FBB544B2133A3246CB.description: Exploring: explore topics related to fashion, and formulate questions to guide their research;
